Clickbait techniques: Large, bold question ('Vaginal Estrogen for EVERYONE?') to provoke curiosity
Use of 'EVERYONE' in all-caps for urgency and universality
Grouping of multiple recognizable products to attract viewers searching for solutions
Brand elements present: Host's name (Steve Goldring, The Hormone Pharmacist)
Distinct product designs instantly recognizable to target audience

Visual reinforcement: The thumbnail directly shows multiple forms of vaginal estrogen, visually supporting the title's focus on 'Vaginal ESTROGEN for EVERY menopausal woman'.
The large central text question mirrors and abbreviates the video's title, teasing the content.
Contrasts/mismatches: The thumbnail does not reference the 'FDA says NO WAY' portion of the title, omitting any negative or cautionary imagery.
Looks purely informative/curious rather than critical, missing an indication of FDA resistance.
